events.name: "Future Cities: Research in Action"@Urban Lab
events.description:
Join us for the launch of Urban Lab, a new dedicated exhibition space by URA that profiles innovative solutions for a sustainable and liveable urban environment. Urban Lab will open with its inaugural exhibition, ‘Future Cities: Research in Action’ by Future Cities Laboratory of the Singapore-ETH Centre. This presents transdisciplinary research on cities, urbanisation and global environmental sustainability, and explores the challenges and opportunities facing cities today. Come and find out how science, design and technology are helping to create a more sustainable and liveable urban future!   
  
FAQs 
1. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By public transport, the nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Please use Exit A and walk along Peck Seah Street.  
By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
2. Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
3. Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event? 
No, you do not need to bring your invitation to the event.
events.location: Urban Redevelopment Authority, The URA Centre Atrium, 45 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069118
events.group_name: Urban Redevelopment Authority and Singapore-ETH Centre

events.name: Friday Hacks #85 - Functional Programming Basics with Scala
events.description: This Friday, we'll be having Sundaravalli Shriram from PayPal speaking about an introduction to functional programming in Scala. See you there! Free pizza is served before the talks. - Talk description This week, the topic for discussion is Functional Programming with Scala. Functional programming is a recent buzz word in the industry. Functional programming involves constructing programs using only pure functions with no side effects such as reading from files or mutating memory. This idea of functional programming, leads to a very different way of writing programs than you may be used to. We therefore start from the very beginning, relearning how to write the simplest of programs in a functional way. We will cover what is functional programming, its benefits and how pure functions can be built to achieve almost all of the regular tasks involved in programming. We will also look at basic Scala syntax and functional programming constructs. We will talk briefly about modelling state-ful programs using pure functions in Scala. - Speaker profile Sundaravalli Shriram, working as a Solutions architect with Paypal Singapore. She has around 16 years of experience in software development. She started her career in India working on C++, VC++. She joining Paypal in Chennai ( India) , and moved to Paypal Singapore a year back. She spent good time with a few product development companies like Tektronix, SCM Microsystems for 9 years, presently working with Paypal for the last 7+ years. She has considerable experience working on full lifecycle projects as a developer, lead and architect. She is passionate about learning new technologies. Initially started as C++ developer when she joined Paypal. Paypal provided her with opportunities to explore web technologies, Java, Node JS, mobile application development and Scala. With exposure to different technologies and stack, She is in a position to compare and provide recommendation on the right stack for different applications based on their requirements. “This is an integral part of my job that makes it interesting” says Sundaravalli Shriram. She is blessed with a Daughter (Sruthi) studying in 10th Grade and Son (Shreyas) in 5th Grade, Both are studying in Global Indian International School in Singapore and her husband Shriram is in business. - Our Sponsors Friday Hacks is sponsored by the NUS Enterprise Center and the Infocomm Development Authority. If you are looking to turn your ideas into a startup and would love some business support, feel free to get in touch with Jason from NUS Enterprise: jasontgw@nus.edu.sg
events.location: LT 15, AS6, National University of Singapore

events.name: Fireplace stories from a Space Artisan
events.description: Giulio Manzoni will talk about methodologies, tools and some anecdotes from 10+ years of work and a video from the satellite making experience (http://www.pop-sat.com/)
